intro: Floscaldasia hysophila, commonly known as the sweetleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
